In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's how you can implement the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(str, " ") # Split the string into words
    result = ""
    for word in words
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
        end
        result *= "$word "
    end
    return result
end
```

You can call this function with a string and an optional `text_width` argument like so:

```julia
print(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Cras in nunc at turpis convallis condimentum.", 20))
```

This will output the string wrapped to a maximum of 20 characters per line:

```julia
"Lorem ipsum dolor sit \namet, consectetur adipiscing elit.\nCras in nunc at turpis convallis \ncondimentum."
```
